top_categories.workout_context: Atlas Mountain Race’s 750-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Atlas Mountain Race’s atlas mountains, ultra-endurance demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Atlas Mountain Race isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Atlas Mountain Race’s atlas mountains ultra-endurance gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Every session at Atlas Mountain Race intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Atlas Mountain Race when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Atlas Mountain Race’s 80,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Atlas Mountain Race rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
At 750 miles, Atlas Mountain Race rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Atlas Mountain Race’s atlas mountains ultra-endurance gravel delivers on race day.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Atlas Mountain Race — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Atlas Mountain Race. Make this intensity feel like home.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 750 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 750 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Atlas Mountain Race with 80,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Atlas Mountain Race demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride atlas mountains ultra-endurance gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: atlas mountains, ultra-endurance, self-supported. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 750 miles.
